questions.question_text: Which of the following management actions would BEST enable an IS auditor to make the most efficient use of analytics software during an audit?

choices.D: Granting the auditor access to anonymized customer data
choices.B: Deploying analytics tools that use natural language processing
choices.C: Providing access to data that is complete and accurate
choices.A: Reviewing audit findings to determine accuracy and relevance

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
While deploying analytics tools with natural language processing (Option B) can enhance the usability of the tools, the foundation for effective analytics is having access to high-quality data. Similarly, reviewing audit findings (Option A) and granting access to anonymized customer data (Option D) are important considerations but might not directly address the efficiency of using analytics software.

In summary, having access to complete and accurate data is fundamental for the efficient use of analytics software during an audit.

questions.question_text: An IS auditor is reviewing an organization's overall incident response capability following recovery from a cybersecurity incident. Which of the following findings should be of MOST concern to the auditor?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I vote D. If there are no lessons learned then they will not improve and what happened could ultimately happen again. To build a robust and growing security team you have to learn from mistakes and document so you can identify the deficiencies and grow.

Selected Answer: B
Logs are crucial for incident detection, investigation, and response. Collecting logs only after an incident has occurred, as part of the post-incident review, suggests that the organization lacks the necessary monitoring and logging capabilities to proactively detect and respond to incidents.

choices.B: Logs were only collected as part of the post-incident review.
choices.A: Risk analysis errors were identified as part of the post-incident review.
choices.C: The incident was caused by a known vulnerability with a documented risk acceptance.
choices.D: Lessons learned were not documented after the incident.

questions.question_text: During the walk-through procedures for an upcoming audit, an IS auditor notes that the key application in scope is part of a Software as a Service (SaaS) agreement. What should the auditor do NEXT?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SLA's should be the first concern

Selected Answer: D
Service level agreements (SLAs) define the level of service that the SaaS provider agrees to offer and the metrics by which that service will be measured. It's crucial for the auditor to ensure that SLAs are clearly defined in the agreement and actively monitored to ensure compliance.

choices.B: Verify whether IT management monitors the effectiveness of the environment.
choices.D: Verify whether service level agreements (SLAs) are defined and monitored.
choices.A: Verify whether a third-party security attestation exists.
choices.C: Verify whether a right-to-audit clause exists.
